name: Bruschetta with Tomato and Basil
steps: Slice the baguette into thin rounds and toast until golden brown.
Dice the tomatoes and mix with chopped basil, minced garlic, olive oil, and a pinch of salt.
Spoon the tomato mixture onto the toasted baguette slices.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and serve immediately.

name: Stuffed Mushrooms
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Remove the stems from the mushrooms and chop them finely.
In a skillet, sauté the chopped stems with minced garlic until softened.
Mix the sautéed stems with cream cheese, parmesan cheese, breadcrumbs, and parsley.
Fill the mushroom caps with the mixture and place them on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until the tops are golden brown.

name: Caprese Skewers
steps: On small skewers, thread a cherry tomato, a basil leaf, and a mozzarella ball.
Repeat until all ingredients are used.
Drizzle the skewers with olive oil and balsamic glaze.
Serve immediately.

name: Deviled Eggs with Bacon
steps: Hard boil the eggs, then peel and cut them in half lengthwise.
Scoop out the yolks and mash them in a bowl with mayonnaise and mustard.
Spoon or pipe the yolk mixture back into the egg whites.
Top each egg with crumbled cooked bacon and a sprinkle of paprika.
Serve immediately.

name: Spinach and Artichoke Dip
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, mix chopped spinach, artichokes, cream cheese, sour cream, grated parmesan cheese, and minced garlic.
Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and spread evenly.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until bubbly and golden on top.
Serve hot with tortilla chips or bread.
